text:
Bronx and Pelham Parkway, east from Williamsbridge Road, showing (right) part of the Pearsall estate.

Summer 1914.

W. D. Hassler.
title: Bronx: Bronx and Pelham Par - Williamsbridge Road

text:
Bronx and Pelham Parkway, east from but not including Williamsbridge Road, showing, on the south side of the Parkway (right), part of the extensive Pearsall estate.

Spring 1914.

W. D. Hassler.
title: Bronx: Bronx and Pelham Par - Market Street

text:
Bronx and pelham Parkway, east from Williamsbridge Road, showing part of the Pearsall Estate offered for sale. It is situated on the south side of the Parkway, east of Williamsbridge Road. It adjoined the famous Morris Park Race Track which was sold in June of 1913.

1914.
title: Bronx: Bronx and Pelham Par - Williamsbridge Road

text:
Bronx and Pelham Parkway, west from Williamsbridge Road. The hand-sign with the inscription Woodmansten Inn, points to the famous inn situated at the N.W. corner of Williamsbridge Road and Van Nest Aves. It was a familiar gathering place for visitors to the Morris Park Race Track, which it adjoined.

About 1923.
title: Bronx: Bronx and Pelham Par - Williamsbridge Road
